data.name: strDefQuitMsg
data.value: Best Chat user {1} has left {2}.

data.name: strGlobalGeneralConnAutoReconnectName
data.value: Reconnect when disconnected unexpectedly

data.name: strGlobalGeneralConnAutoReconnectToolTipText
data.value: When your connection is lost unexpectedly, Best Chat can automatically reconnect to the server for you.

data.name: strGlobalGeneralConnCharEncodingName
data.value: C_haracter Encoding

data.name: strGlobalGeneralConnCharEncodingToolTipName
data.value: For multiple clients to correctly read messages with non-ASCII characters on IRC, they need to use the same character encoding.

data.name: strGlobalGeneralConnDefQuitMsgName
data.value: Default Quit _Message

data.name: strGlobalGeneralConnDefQuitMsgToolTipText
data.value: Specifies a default quit message to use when on is not explicitly specified for a network or via the /quit command.

data.name: strGlobalGeneralConnEnableIdentName
data.value: Enable _Identification Server during connection process

data.name: strGlobalGeneralConnEnableIdentToolTipText
data.value: Allows Best Chat to connect to servers that require an ident response

data.name: strGlobalGeneralConnMaxAttemptsName
data.value: Maximum Connection _Attempts:

data.name: strGlobalGeneralConnMaxAttemptsToolTipText
data.value: This is number of times Best Chat attempts to connect to a server or network. A value of 1 means Best Chat will never attempt to reconnect to the server.

data.name: strGlobalGeneralConnName
data.value: _Connection

data.name: strGlobalGeneralConnRejoinAfterKickName
data.value: R_ejoin when kicked

data.name: strGlobalGeneralConnRejoinAfterKickToolTipText
data.value: If this is turned on, Best Chat will try (only once) to rejoin a channel you got kicked from. Note: Some channels dislike auto-rejoin and will ban you. So be careful.

data.name: strGlobalGeneralConnToolTipText
data.value: These preferences affect how Best Chat connects to the Internet.

data.name: strGlobalGeneralConnUnlimitedAttemptsName
data.value: Unlimited Attempts?

data.name: strGlobalGeneralConnUnlimitedAttemptsToolTipText
data.value: If checked, Best Chat will attempt to reconnect to any server forever. If unchecked, the limit will be to the right.

data.name: strGlobalGeneralName
data.value: _General

data.name: strGlobalGeneralToolTipText
data.value: Many preferences that don't have anywhere else go here.

data.name: strGlobalName
data.value: _Global

data.name: strGlobalNameToolTipText
data.value: These preferences affect the entire application.

data.name: strGlobalAppearancePageTitle
data.value: Appearance

data.name: strGlobalAppearancePageDesc
data.value: Configures the overall appearance of the entire application

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceConfModeTitle
data.value: Conference Mode

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceConfModeDesc
data.value: These settings control the configuration of Conference Mode. It lets you hide joins, parts, and quits in busy channels. All hidden events can be viewed by hovering your mouse over the event.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceConfModeLimitTitle
data.value: User Limit Before Trigger

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceConfModeLimitDesc
data.value: If the number of users in the system goes above this number, Conference Mode would be activated. That would cause parts, joins, and quits to be hidden unless you hover over the event marker.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceConfModeEnabledTitle
data.value: Enable Conference Mode?

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceConfModeEnabledDesc
data.value: Check this if you want Conference Mode enabled. Uncheck it if you always want to see parts, joins, and quits.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceConfModeCollapseActionsTitle
data.value: Collapse Actions When Collapsing Messages?

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceConfModeCollapseActionsDesc
data.value: When collapsing messages in conference mode, Best Chat can also collapse actions. Do you want this behavior?

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceConfModeCollapseMsgsTitle
data.value: Collapse Messages?

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceConfModeCollapseMsgsDesc
data.value: In Conference Mode, Best Chat can collapse messages. Do you want that?

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceFontTitle
data.value: Font

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceFontDesc
data.value: These settings control the font used. By default, the font is specified by your theme, but you can override it here.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceFontNormalFamilyTitle
data.value: Normal Family

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceFontNormalFamilyDesc
data.value: Use this to override the normal font family specified by your theme. Set the fixed width font separately below.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceFontFixedWidthFamilyTitle
data.value: Fixed Width Family

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceFontFixedWidthFamilyDesc
data.value: Best Chat switches forts when the formatting calls for a fixed width font. Most fonts are what they call variable pitch. That means the width in pixels of a 'I" is far less than the width of a 'W'. By contrast, a fixed width font uses the same width for all characters.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceFontSizeTitle
data.value: Font Size

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceFontSizeDesc
data.value: Use this to make all fonts larger or smaller. The value shown is measured in pixels.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceFontWeightTitle
data.value: Font Weight

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceTimeStampTitle
data.value: Time Stamps

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceTimeStampDesc
data.value: Best Chat records when each event happens and can show or hide those. You can control if they're shown or not along with their format.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceTimeStampShowTitle
data.value: Show the time stamp?

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceTimeStampShowDesc
data.value: Check this if you want to see time stamps and uncheck it if you don't.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceTimeStampFmtTitle
data.value: Format

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceTimeStampFmtDesc
data.value: If you want to use a custom time stamp format, specify it here. Read the notes above on how to specify it. Certain characters in the value will be treated special.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceUserListLeftTitle
data.value: Left

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceUserListLeftDesc
data.value: Places the user list on the left side of the client area.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceUserListRightTitle
data.value: Right

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceUserListRightDesc
data.value: Places the user list on the right side of the client area.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceUserListLocDesc
data.value: Specify if you want the user list on the left or right.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceUserListLocTitle
data.value: Location

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceUserListSortByModeDesc
data.value: Check if you'd like the user list to be sorted by name and mode. That will highlight ops by placing them at the top of the list. Uncheck it if you prefer the users to be sorted only by name.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceUserListSortByModeTitle
data.value: Sort by Mode

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceUserLIstWaysToShowModesColoredDiscsDesc
data.value: If you select this, colored discs will be used to indicate op/half op status and voice.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceUserLIstWaysToShowModesColoredDiscsTitle
data.value: Colored Discs

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceUserListWaysToShowModesDesc
data.value: Use these choices to control how Best Chat marks select users as special. Unless you choose “Hidden”, Best Chat will tell you which users are ops, half ops, or have voice.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceUserListWaysToShowModesSymbolsDesc
data.value: If you select this, Best Chat will show op, half op, and voice with traditional symbols.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceUserListWaysToShowModesSymbolsTitle
data.value: Use symbols

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceUserListWaysToShowModesTitle
data.value: How should we show the user modes?

data.name: strGlobalPluginsDesc
data.value: Best Chat supports two forms of plug-ins: External and Internal. External plug-ins re those that it needs an external program or the OS to run. Internal ones are those that rely on an API exported by Best Chat. Click a link below to configure each type.

data.name: strGlobalPluginsExtDesc
data.value: It's a security risk as you might run who knows what, but Best Chat does support external plug-ins (run by external programs). As noted, these might be binaries your OS knows how to run or scripts.

data.name: strGlobalPluginsExtTitle
data.value: External

data.name: strGlobalPluginsExtWhereToLookDesc
data.value: Specifies a series of paths you want Best Chat to consider as containing external plug-ins. Chat will look in each location during start and create commands for all executables in those locations. On Windows, anything with the extensions CMD, PS1, or EXE will be treated as plugins. On MacOS, Linux, Unix, and other similar operating systems, that will be anything with the mode +x on files in those paths. For all operating systems, Best Chat will add anything whose extension is listed in the bottom of this box. If you aren't running Windows, but want to include EXEs, add Wine. Also, non-Windows users that want to use PowerShell scripts may need to install PS.

data.name: strGlobalPluginsExtWhereToLookPathsTitle
data.value: Paths

data.name: strGlobalPluginsExtWhereToLookTitle
data.value: Where to Look

data.name: strGlobalPluginsHowToRunThemDesc
data.value:
Lists programs that Best Chat will attempt to use to run an external plug-in. If you don't want any files of a certain type to be run by Best Chat, remove it from the list. The two tabs below show the same data. One just groups the data so that all types supported by a program are shown together if both file types use the same parameters to the executing program. The other lets you quickly find a specific type.
With Linux, anything marked with the +x file mode is treated as a binary executable if there is no file type listed below for that file or the file lacks a file extension. In the parameter list, any %s will be replaced with the full path to the script. In here, if you don't specify the path as that comes from a search along your computer's PATH environment variable. If that path changes, the actual program might change. In that case, Best Chat will detect the change and ask you to approve the change or disable the program and file type it runs.

data.name: strGlobalPluginsHowToRunThemTitle
data.value: How to run them

data.name: strGlobalPluginsTitle
data.value: Plugins

data.name: strGlobalPluginsExtWhereToLookIncludeSysPathDesc
data.value: Check this to automatically search all directories in your OS's system path environment variable. This is normally called PATH. This is checked after those explicitly listed here.

data.name: strGlobalPluginsExtWhereToLookIncludeSysPathTitle
data.value: Include Your System Path Environment Variable in the Search

data.name: strGlobalPluginsHowToRunThemGroupedByWhatRunsThemDesc
data.value: Lists all script types by how they're run.

data.name: strGlobalPluginsHowToRunThemGroupedByWhatRunsThemTitle
data.value: Grouped by what runs them

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceUserListWaysToShowModesHiddenDesc
data.value: Select if you don't need to know who is an op, half-op, or has voice.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceUserListWaysToShowModesHiddenTitle
data.value: Hidden (no modes visible)

data.name: strGlobalPluginsExtWhereToLookPathsDesc
data.value: Specify where to look for files. This should be a list of folders AKA directories. The order is important. Best Chat starts with the first entry in the list and continues from there. System paths, if enabled, are checked AFTER the entries here.
